greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Tetrahedron with T(t,n,k) = t - n; succession of growing finite triangles with declining values per row.
link: Peter Luschny, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (first 105 terms by Henry Bottomley).
example: First triangle: [0]; second triangle: [1; 0 0]; third triangle: [2; 1 1; 0 0 0]; ...
program: for j in ((k:-1:1) for k in 1:n)
xref: Together with A056558 and A056560 might enable reading "by antidiagonals" of cube arrays as 3-dimensional analog of A002262 and A025581 with square arrays.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jun 26 2000
